column1: Isn't it clear that the 1964 U.S. escalation in Vietnam lacked any real justification?
Wasn't the Soviet deployment of missiles to Cuba in 1962 a justified response to the U.S.?
Wouldn't you agree that the 2003 U.S. invasion of Iraq lacked adequate justification?
Isn't it obvious that the U.S. use of atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in WW2 was unnecessary?
Wouldn't a fair assessment be that the 1983 U.S. invasion of Grenada lacked adequate justification?
Isn't it clear that the 1989 U.S. invasion of Panama lacked justification?
Isn't it the case that the USAAF's 1945 bombing of Dresden lacked any genuine military justification?
